0,"In a letter to Steve Jobs, Sean Connery refused to appear in an apple commercial.","When did an image of a purported letter from Sean Connery to Steve Jobs become available online?

An image of a purported 1998 letter from actor Sean Connery (famous for his portrayal of agent James Bond) to Apple CEO Steve Jobs, caustically rebuffing an offer to become a pitchman for Apple Computers, hit the Internet in June 2011.
Is there any evidence that Sean Connery sent a letter to Steve Jobs in 1998 refusing to appear in an Apple commercial?
First, the bad news. Sean Connery never actually sent a typewritten letter to Steve Jobs in 1998 refusing to be in an Apple ad.
How many times did Sean Connery decline to participate in an Apple commercial as requested by Steve Jobs?

Though Steve had a thing for Sean Connery, the feeling was not mutual. Connery was appalled by the “advert” Jobs sent across the pond and declined to participate in the misadventure on at least three separate occasions.
What is the nature of the letter mentioned in the evidence?
Do you know who I am? A faked letter from James Bond star Sir Sean Connery firmly rejected an apparent advertising role from Apple chief Steve Jobs
In what book was it said that details of Steve Jobs' attempt to recruit Sean Connery to appear in an Apple commercial were revealed?
Details of how Jobs tried to recruit Connery to flag up struggling sales in 1998 were said to have been revealed in a book on the history of the firm.
What was the purpose of the ad that Steve Jobs instructed his agency to work on, according to the text?

Steve Jobs, a lifelong fan of James Bond (he'd originally wanted to name the revolutionary computer ""Double-O-Mac""), instructed his agency to begin work on a special celebrity Christmas ad featuring 007 himself, Sean Connery — even though Connery had yet to be signed.
What is the context in which Sean Connery's connection to Steve Jobs was discovered?
One would think that the only thing 007 Sean Connery has in common with Apple co-founder Steve Jobs is a penchant for cool gadgets but this morning’s tweets proved otherwise.
Is the letter to Steve Jobs from Sean Connery rejecting an offer to appear in an Apple ad genuine?
'I am f****** James Bond': Sean Connery letter to Steve Jobs rejecting offer to appear in Apple ad revealed to be fake
Where did the claim that Sean Connery refused to appear in an Apple commercial originate?
The Apple satirical site Scoopertino initially published the fake letter on June 19. They claim that Jobs has been a life-long Bond fan who wanted to call the first computer the Double-O-Mac.
What was the purpose of the ad that Steve Jobs instructed his agency to work on?

Steve Jobs, a lifelong fan of James Bond (he’d originally wanted to name the revolutionary computer “Double-O-Mac”), instructed his agency to begin work on a special celebrity Christmas ad featuring 007 himself, Sean Connery — even though Connery had yet to be signed.
